means: （尤指因催眠或精神疾患，或为逃避目前忧虑）回到从前

word_mean: 倒退：回复至以前或早期阶段
消退：疾病过程或症状的平息
退化：生物学中，指后代向折中状态发展的趋势，见law项下的Galtons law of regression
退行：思想或行为回复至早期(特别是婴幼儿期)的型式，是许多精神疾患的特点，正常人在许多情况下亦可有此一表现。退行的表现不见于严重精神病患者的精神无助感和依赖感
回归：指随机变量(应变量)与实验者确定的一个或多个变量(自变量)之间的函数关系，通常即应变量的条件均值。例如Y对Χ的回归(或回归曲线)，则为与每一Χ值有关的Y平均值的图形
又称“退行”。动物发育到一定阶段后，其体型出现退缩性变化的现象。退化可出现在组织分化过程，也可出现于生长过程，前者为分化退化，后者为生长退化。

sentence.Network_en: This can cause regression in a pupil's learning process.
sentence.Network_cn: 这可能会使学生在学习过程中退步。

sentence.Network_en: The effect of colinearity is to make the regression coefficients unreliable.
sentence.Network_cn: 共线性的影响是使回归系数不可靠.

sentence.Network_en: Characteristic defects are of two main types; regression and syneresis.
sentence.Network_cn: 特征缺陷主要有两类: 即退化和脱水收缩.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin regressio(n-), from regredi 'go back, return' (see regress)

entry.def: When people or things regress, they return to an earlier and less advanced stage of development.

example.ex: ...if your child regresses to babyish behaviour...
example.tran: 如果你的孩子退行到婴儿状态

example.ex: Such countries are not 'developing' at all, but regressing.
example.tran: 这些国家根本不是在“发展中”，而是在倒退。

means.word_mean: 1. an abnormal state in which development has stopped prematurely
2. (psychiatry) a defense mechanism in which you flee from reality by assuming a more infantile state
3. the relation between selected values of x and observed values of y (from which the most probable value of y can be predicted for any value of x)
